00041 
00042 /* defines.h contains definitions of device registers etc */
00043 #include <inttypes.h>
00044 #include <avr/sfr_defs.h>
00045 #include <avr/io.h>
00046 #include <avr/wdt.h>
00047 #include "defines.h"
00048 #include "serial-programmer-at90s2313.h"
00049 #include <util/delay.h>
00050 /* functions to send/receive */
00051 #include "serial.h"
00052 
00053 #define TRUE 1
00054 #define FALSE 0
00055 /* Convenience macros (we don't use them all) */
00056 #define  _BV(bit) (1 << (bit))
00057 #define  inb(sfr) _SFR_BYTE(sfr)
00058 #define  inw(sfr) _SFR_WORD(sfr)
00059 #define  outb(sfr, val) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) = (val))
00060 #define  outw(sfr, val) (_SFR_WORD(sfr) = (val))
00061 #define  cbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) &= ~_BV(bit))
00062 #define  sbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) |= _BV(bit))
00063 #define  high(x) ((uint8_t) (x >> 8) & 0xFF)
00064 #define  low(x) ((uint8_t) (x & 0xFF))
00065 
00066 #define APP_END 0x2000
00067 
00068 /***************************************************************************************/
00074 uint16_t address;                   // Address to program
00075 unsigned char command;              // received instruction character
00076 uint8_t result;
00077 uint8_t tempInt;
00078 uint8_t lsbAddress;
00079 uint8_t msbAddress;
00080 uint8_t buffer[4];                  // Buffer to store response from target
00081 
00082 int main(void)
00083 {
00084 
00085 /* Initialise hardware timers and ports. All start off as inputs */
00086 /* Set PORTB as outputs on bits 7,5,4,1,0 to set controls, and set high, input on bit 6 */
00087     outb(DDRB,((inb(DDRB)&0x0C) | 0xB3));   // Keep PB2 and PB3 free only
00088     outb(PORTB,(inb(PORTB) | 0xB3));
00089     sbi(ACSR,7);                            // Turn off Analogue Comparator
00090     initbootuart();                         // Initialize UART.
00091 
00092 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00093 /* Main loop. We exit this only with an "E" command. */
00094     {
00095         for(;;)
00096         {
00097             command = recchar();
00098 // ** Check autoincrement status **
00099 // This allows a block of data to be uploaded to consecutive addresses without
00100 // specifying the address each time
00101             if(command=='a')
00102             {
00103                 sendchar('Y');                          // Yes, we will autoincrement.
00104             }
00105 
00106 // ** Set address **
00107 // This is stored and incremented for each upload/download.
00108 // NOTE: Flash addresses are given as word addresses, not byte addresses.
00109             else if(command=='A')                       // Set address
00110             {
00111                 address=(recchar()<<8) | recchar();     // Read address high and low byte.
00112                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00113             }
00114 
00115 // ** Check block load support **
00116            else if(command=='b')
00117             {
00118                 sendchar('Y');                          // Report block load supported.
00119                 sendchar(high(BLOCKSIZE));              // MSB first.
00120                 sendchar(low(BLOCKSIZE));               // Report BLOCKSIZE (bytes).
00121             }
00122 
00123 // ** Get programmer type **
00124             else if (command=='p')
00125             {
00126                 sendchar('S');                          // Answer 'SERIAL'.
00127             }
00128 
00129 // ** Return supported device codes **
00130 //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00131             else if(command=='t')
00132             {
00133 #if PARTCODE+0 > 0
00134                 sendchar( PARTCODE );                   // Supports only this device, of course.
00135 #endif /* PARTCODE */
00136                 sendchar( 0 );                          // Send list terminator.
00137             }
00138 
00139 // ** Set LED, clear LED and set device type **
00140 //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00141             else if((command=='x')||(command=='y')||(command=='T'))
00142             {
00143                 recchar();  
00144                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00145             }
00146 
00147 // ** Return programmer identifier **
00148             else if(command=='S')
00149             {
00150                 sendchar('A');
00151                 sendchar('V');                          // ID always 7 characters.
00152                 sendchar('R');
00153                 sendchar('S');
00154                 sendchar('P');
00155                 sendchar('R');
00156                 sendchar('G');
00157             }
00158 
00159 // ** Return software version **
00160             else if(command=='V')
00161             {
00162                 sendchar('0');
00163                 sendchar('0');
00164             }
00165 
00166 //======================================================================================
00167 // ** Enter programming mode **
00168 // This starts the programming of the device
00169 // Pulse the reset line high while SCK is low
00170 // Send the command and ensure that the echoed second byte is correct, otherwise redo
00171             else if(command=='P')
00172             {
00173                 while (result != 0x53)
00174                 {
00175                     cbi(PORTB,SCK);     // Set serial clock low
00176                     sbi(PORTB,RESET);   // Pulse reset line off
00177                     _delay_us(100);     // Delay to let CPU know that programming will occur
00178                     cbi(PORTB,RESET);   // Pulse reset line on
00179                     _delay_us(20000);   // 20ms delay
00180                     writeCommand(0xAC,0x53,0x00,0x00);    // "Start programming" command
00181                     result=buffer[2];
00182                 }
00183                 result = 0;
00184                 sendchar('\r');         // Answer OK.
00185             }
00186 
00187 // ** Leave programming mode **
00188             else if(command=='L')
00189             {
00190                 sbi(PORTB,RESET);       // Pulse reset line off
00191                 sendchar('\r');         // Answer OK.
00192             }
00193 
00194 // ** Chip erase **
00195             else if(command=='e')
00196             {
00197                 writeCommand(0xAC,0x80,0x00,0x00);      // Erase command
00198                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00199             }
00200 
00201 // ** Read program memory **
00202             else if(command=='R')
00203             {
00204 // Send high byte, then low byte of flash word.
00205 // Send each byte from the address specified (note address variable is modified).
00206                 lsbAddress = low(address);
00207                 msbAddress = high(address);
00208                 writeCommand(0x28,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);
00209                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00210                 writeCommand(0x20,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);
00211                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00212                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next Flash word.
00213             }
00214 
00215 // ** Write program memory, low byte **
00216 // NOTE: Always use this command before sending high byte. It is written to the
00217 // page but the address is not incremented.
00218             else if(command=='c')
00219             {
00220                 writeCommand(0x40,0x00,address&0x7F,recchar());   // Low byte
00221                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00222             }
00223 
00224 // ** Write program memory, high byte **
00225 // This will cause the word to be written to the page and the address incremented. It is
00226 // the responsibility of the user to issue a page write command.
00227             else if(command=='C')
00228             {
00229                 writeCommand(0x48,0x00,address&0x7F,recchar());   // High Byte
00230                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next Flash word.
00231                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00232             }
00233 
00234 // ** Issue Page Write **
00235             else if(command== 'm')
00236             {
00237                 if( address >= (APP_END>>1) )           // Outside memory area
00238                     sendchar('?');
00239                 else
00240                     writeCommand(0x4C,address&0x7F,address&0x80,0x00); // Write Page
00241                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00242             }
00243 // ** Write EEPROM memory **
00244 // This writes the byte directly to the EEPROM at the specified address
00245             else if (command == 'D')
00246             {
00247                 lsbAddress = low(address);
00248                 msbAddress = high(address);
00249                 writeCommand(0xC0,msbAddress,lsbAddress,recchar());    // EEPROM byte
00250                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next EEPROM byte.
00251                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00252             }
00253 
00254 // ** Read EEPROM memory **
00255             else if (command == 'd')
00256             {
00257                 lsbAddress = low(address);
00258                 msbAddress = high(address);
00259                 writeCommand(0xA0,msbAddress,lsbAddress, 0x00);
00260                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00261                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next EEPROM byte.
00262             }
00263 
00264 // ** Read lock bits **
00265             else if(command=='r')
00266             {
00267                 writeCommand(0x58,0x00,0x00,0x00);
00268                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00269             }
00270 
00271 // ** Write lockbits **
00272             else if(command=='l')
00273             {
00274                 writeCommand(0xAC,0xE0,0x00,recchar());  // EEPROM byte
00275                 sendchar('\r');     // Send OK back.
00276             }
00277 
00278 // ** Read fuse bits **
00279             else if(command=='F')
00280             {
00281                 writeCommand(0x50,0x00,0x00,0x00);
00282                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00283             }
00284 
00285 // ** Write fuse bits **
00286             else if(command=='f')
00287             {
00288                 writeCommand(0xAC,0xA0,0x00,recchar());  // Fuse byte
00289                 sendchar('\r');     // Send OK back.
00290             }
00291 
00292 // ** Read high fuse bits **
00293             else if(command=='N')
00294             {
00295                 writeCommand(0x58,0x08,0x00,0x00);
00296                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00297             }
00298 
00299 // ** Read extended fuse bits **
00300             else if(command=='Q')
00301             {
00302                 writeCommand(0x50,0x08,0x00,0x00);
00303                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00304             }
00305 //++++++++++++++++ Does not appear to be commands to write high or extended fuse bits
00306 
00307 // ** Return signature bytes **
00308             else if(command=='s')
00309             {
00310                 writeCommand(0x30,0x00,0x00,0x00);
00311                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00312                 writeCommand(0x30,0x00,0x01,0x00);
00313                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00314                 writeCommand(0x30,0x00,0x02,0x00);
00315                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00316             }
00317 
00318 // ** Exit bootloader **
00319 // At this command we enter serial passthrough and don't return from it until reset
00320 // At the same time we should lift the reset from the target.
00321             else if(command=='E')
00322             {
00323 //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00324                 sbi(PORTB,RESET);                       // Pulse reset line off
00325                 sendchar('\r');
00326             }
00327 
00328 // The last command to accept is ESC (synchronization)
00329 // This is used to abort any command by filling in remaining parameters, after which
00330 // it is simply ignored.
00331 // Otherwise, the command is not recognized and a "?" is returned.
00332             else if(command!=0x1b)                      // If not ESC, then it is unrecognized
00333             {
00334                 sendchar('?');
00335             }
00336         } // end: for(;;)
00337     }
00338 } // end: main
00339 
00340 /********************************************************************************/
00356 unsigned char BlockLoad(uint16_t size, unsigned char mem, uint16_t *address)
00357 {
00358     uint8_t buffer[BLOCKSIZE];
00359 
00360 // Fill SRAM buffer first from the serial interface
00361     if (size > BLOCKSIZE)
00362     {
00363         return '?';                                      // Don't let's crash
00364     }
00365     for(uint8_t n=0;n<size;n++)
00366         buffer[n] = recchar();
00367 
00368     uint8_t tempAddr = (*address);                       // Store the page address
00369 
00370 // EEPROM memory type. This has a typical page size of only 4.
00371     if(mem=='E')
00372     {
00373         uint8_t eepromPageSize = EPAGESIZE;
00374         for(uint16_t n=0; n < size; n+=2)
00375         {
00376             do writeCommand(0xF0,0x00,0x00,0x00);
00377             while ((buffer[3]&0x01) == 0);               // Wait for busy flag
00378             uint8_t lsbAddress = (*address)|(EPAGESIZE-1);      // Address in page
00379             writeCommand(0xC1, 0x00, lsbAddress, buffer[n]);    // EEPROM byte
00380             (*address)++;                                // Select next byte in memory.
00381             if (eepromPageSize--)
00382             {
00383                 writeCommand(0xC2, tempAddr&(EPAGESIZE-1), tempAddr&!(EPAGESIZE-1), 0x00); // Write Page
00384                 eepromPageSize = EPAGESIZE;
00385                 tempAddr = (*address);                   // Refresh the page address
00386             }
00387         }
00388         if (eepromPageSize < EPAGESIZE)
00389             writeCommand(0xC2, tempAddr&(EPAGESIZE-1), tempAddr&!(EPAGESIZE-1), 0x00); // Write Page
00390         return '\r';                                     // Report programming OK
00391     }
00392     else
00393 // FLASH memory type.
00394     if(mem=='F')
00395 // NOTE: For flash programming, 'address' is given in words. MSB and LSB
00396 // are presented as if a byte address. Only the first 7 bits are used, with the
00397 // 8th bit of the LSB sent up with the page address.
00398     {
00399         uint8_t flashPageSize = FPAGESIZE;
00400         for(uint16_t n=0; n < size; n+=2)
00401         {
00402             do writeCommand(0xF0,0x00,0x00,0x00);
00403             while ((buffer[3]&0x01) == 0);               // Wait for busy flag
00404             uint8_t lsbAddress = (*address)&0x7F;
00405             writeCommand(0x40, 0x00, lsbAddress, buffer[n]);    // Low byte
00406             writeCommand(0x48, 0x00, lsbAddress, buffer[n+1]);  // High Byte
00407             (*address)++;                                // Select next word in memory.
00408             if (flashPageSize--)
00409             {
00410                 writeCommand(0x4C, tempAddr&0x03, tempAddr&0xFC, 0x00); // Write Page
00411                 flashPageSize = FPAGESIZE;
00412                 tempAddr = (*address);                   // Refresh the page address
00413             }
00414         }
00415         if (flashPageSize < FPAGESIZE)
00416             writeCommand(0x4C, tempAddr&0x7F, tempAddr&0x80, 0x00); // Write Page
00417         return '\r';                                     // Report programming OK
00418     }
00419     else
00420 // Invalid memory type?
00421     {
00422         return '?';
00423     }
00424 }
00425 
00426 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00436 unsigned char BlockRead(unsigned int size, unsigned char mem, uint16_t *address)
00437 {
00438 // EEPROM memory type.
00439     if (mem=='E')
00440     {
00441         for(uint16_t n=0; n < size; n+=2)
00442         {
00443             lsbAddress = low(*address);
00444             msbAddress = high(*address);
00445             writeCommand(0xA0,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);
00446             sendchar(buffer[3]);
00447             (*address)++;                                // Select next EEPROM byte
00448         }
00449         return '\r';                                     // Report programming OK
00450     }
00451     else
00452 // FLASH memory type.
00453     if(mem=='F')
00454     {
00455         for(uint16_t n=0; n < size; n+=2)
00456         {
00457             lsbAddress = low(*address);
00458             msbAddress = high(*address);
00459             writeCommand(0xA8,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);  // High Byte
00460             sendchar(buffer[3]);
00461             writeCommand(0xA0,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);  // Low Byte
00462             sendchar(buffer[3]);
00463             (*address)++;                                // Select next FLASH word
00464         }
00465         return '\r';                                     // Report programming OK
00466     }
00467     else
00468 // Invalid memory type?
00469     {
00470         return '?';
00471     }
00472 }
00473 
00474 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00486 uint8_t writeByte(const uint8_t datum)
00487 {
00488     uint8_t value = datum;
00489     uint8_t response = 0;
00490     for (uint8_t n=0; n < 8;  n++)
00491     {
00492         outb(PORTB,(inb(PORTB)&~_BV(MOSI))|((value&0x80)>>(7-MOSI)));// Shift data MSB and put to MISO pin
00493         _delay_us(1);                                   // Give him some time to settle
00494         sbi(PORTB,SCK);                                 // Raise SCK to latch output data
00495         _delay_us(1);                                   // Give him some time to settle
00496         response <<= 1;                                 // Prepare response for next input bit
00497         response |= (inb(PINB)&_BV(MISO))>>MISO;        // Add in next bit read
00498         cbi(PORTB,SCK);                                 // Drop SCK ready for next time
00499         value <<= 1;                                    // Move to expose next bit
00500     }
00501     return response;
00502 }
00503 
00504 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00516 void writeCommand(const uint8_t cmd, const uint8_t parm1, const uint8_t parm2, const uint8_t parm3)
00517 {
00518     buffer[0] = writeByte(cmd);
00519     buffer[1] = writeByte(parm1);
00520     buffer[2] = writeByte(parm2);
00521     buffer[3] = writeByte(parm3);
00522 }
